channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: マーベルVFXの従業員50人以上がIATSEの代表となることを投票で決定、VFXプロフェッショナルが結束して組合を結成するのは初めてのこと（Chris Lee/Vulture）
item.description:
Chris Lee / Vulture:
A group of 50+ Marvel VFX employees vote to be represented by IATSE, marking the first time VFX professionals have banded together to form a union  —  Call it the Hollywood-labor-organizing version of Avengers Assemble!  On the heels of more than a year's worth of damning disclosures around …

item.title: アップルは大物キャストを起用した質の高い脚本コンテンツでHBOを "アウトHBO "しているが、視聴率、契約数、収入における配当は不透明（The Ringer）
item.description:
The Ringer:
Apple is “out-HBOing” HBO with quality scripted content filled with marquee casts, but its dividends in viewership, subscriptions, and revenue are murkier  —  Apple TV+ has amassed a rich library of original content in less than four years—with the awards season nominations to prove it.

item.title: パラマウント、第2四半期の売上高は前年同期比2％減の$7.6B、損失は$250M、サブスクリプション収入は前年同期比47％増の$1.20B+、Paramount+の加入者数は約70万人増の約61M（Caitlin Huston/The Hollywood Reporter）
item.description:
Caitlin Huston / The Hollywood Reporter:
Paramount reports Q2 revenue down 2% YoY to $7.6B and a $250M loss; subscription revenue grew 47% YoY to $1.2B+; Paramount+ added ~700K subscribers to hit ~61M  —  The media giant reported 60 million paid subscribers for Paramount+ last quarter.  —  Paramount Global reached 61 million …

item.title: パラマウント社、サイモン＆シュスター社をプライベート・エクイティ会社KKRに売却する16.2億ドルの合意に達する。
item.description:
New York Times:
Paramount reaches a $1.62B deal to sell Simon & Schuster to private equity firm KKR; the prestigious US publisher was first put up for sale in March 2020  —  The deal, for $1.62 billion, will put control of a cultural touchstone in the hands of a financial buyer.

item.title: NBCユニバーサルは、SAG-AFTRAのストライキによりシーズン2のプロモーションが禁止されている『キリング・イット』シーズン1の最初の3エピソードをYouTubeとTikTokで公開した（Lesley Goldberg/Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Lesley Goldberg / Hollywood Reporter:
NBCUniversal makes the first three Killing It Season 1 episodes available on YouTube and TikTok, as SAG-AFTRA's strike bars its stars from promoting Season 2  —  Without star Craig Robinson to promote the return for season two, NBCUniversal is turning to other alternatives.

item.title: 情報筋WBDはMLBプレーオフの開幕をターゲットに、マックス向けのスポーツ専門チャンネルを立ち上げ、「ブリーチャー・リポート」ブランドを使って若い視聴者をターゲットにする計画（Alex Sherman/CNBC）
item.description:
Alex Sherman / CNBC:
Sources: WBD is targeting the beginning of the MLB playoffs to debut a sports tier for Max, planning to use the Bleacher Report brand to target young audiences  —  - Warner Bros. Discovery plans to simulcast live games on cable TV and Max streaming in October.

item.title: TikTok、ライブストリームで開催される音楽コンテスト「Gimme the Mic」を発表、米国の勝者には50K Diamondsが贈られる（米ドル換算レートは不明）（Mia Sato/The Verge
item.description:
Mia Sato / The Verge:
TikTok unveils Gimme the Mic, a music competition hosted on livestreams where the US winner receives 50K Diamonds, the USD conversion rate for which is unclear  —  TikTok will host a music contest similar to popular talent shows like The Voice, the company announced today.

item.title: 英国の地域メディアグループ「ナショナル・ワールド」が、「リアルな英国」「サッカー」「犯罪」をテーマに、スタッフによる短編ビデオを24時間365日放映するFreeviewチャンネル「ショット！」をデビュー（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
UK regional media group National World debuts Shots!, a 24/7 Freeview channel showing short videos by its staff around the themes “real UK”, football, and crime  —  The new channel draws together video shot by the company's reporters around the UK.

item.title: ジェフ・ザッカーCEO率いるRedBird IMIが、元タイム・スタジオCOOのイアン・オレフィチェが率いる新しいノンフィクション・コンテンツ・スタジオ、EverWonderに初のメディア投資を行う（Alex Weprin/Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Alex Weprin / Hollywood Reporter:
RedBird IMI, led by CEO Jeff Zucker, makes its first media investment in EverWonder, a new non-fiction content studio led by former Time Studios COO Ian Orefice  —  The ex-Time Studios chief says that EverWonder Studio will be hiring journalists and filmmakers, with an eye toward content that could launch new IP or brand extensions.

item.title: フランスを拠点とする日曜紙『ル・ジャーナル・デュ・ディマンシュ』の記者の半数以上が、ストライキでも極右編集長の就任を阻止できず辞任（Jon Henley/The Guardian）
item.description:
Jon Henley / The Guardian:
Over half of the journalists at France-based Sunday newspaper Le Journal du Dimanche resign after their strike didn't prevent the arrival of a far-right editor  —  Bitter strike at Journal du Dimanche ends with staff exodus - and arrival of Geoffroy Lejeune, a supporter of leading xenophobe Eric Zemmour

item.title: 英国の放送規制機関Ofcomは、2023年初めに2件のマーク・ステインCOVID-19報道の苦情を支持した後、GBニュースに対して4件の公平性調査を開始した（Dominic Ponsford/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Dominic Ponsford / Press Gazette:
UK broadcast regulator Ofcom launches four impartiality investigations into GB News, after upholding two Mark Steyn COVID-19 coverage complaints earlier in 2023  —  Broadcaster faces four Ofcom investigations over impartiality.  —  GB News is facing four new impartiality investigations from broadcast regulator Ofcom.

item.title: 日刊紙「ベルリン・ツァイトゥング」を買収し、再建を主導して以来、論争に巻き込まれているドイツの大富豪ホルガー・フリードリッヒの横顔（フィナンシャル・タイムズ紙）
item.description:
Financial Times:
A profile of German millionaire Holger Friedrich, who has been engulfed by controversies since acquiring and leading a turnaround of the daily Berliner Zeitung  —  East German entrepreneur has been engulfed by a string of controversies since buying historic Berliner Zeitung

item.title: コムスコア：『バービー』が公開17日後に全世界興行収入10億ドルを突破、女性単独監督映画として初の快挙（Sara Fischer/Axios）
item.description:
Sara Fischer / Axios:
Comscore: Barbie earns $1B+ in worldwide box office sales 17 days after its release, becoming the first movie solely directed by a woman to cross the threshold  —  “Barbie” has earned more than $1 billion in worldwide box office sales, according to Comscore.

item.title: 情報源：NYTは2023年初め、ジェーン・アラフ・バグダッド支局長を休職処分にした。
item.description:
Max Tani / Semafor:
Sources: the NYT placed Baghdad bureau chief Jane Arraf on leave earlier in 2023 during a probe into her possible misuse of funds, like overpaying non-US staff  —  The Scoop  —  The New York Times fired its second Baghdad bureau chief in five years in a bizarre saga that has infuriated some of the paper's staff in the Middle East.

item.title: 情報筋Paramountは、早ければ8月7日にもSimon & Schusterをプライベート・エクイティ会社KKRに売却する合意を発表する予定。
item.description:
New York Times:
Sources: Paramount plans to announce an agreement to sell Simon & Schuster to private equity firm KKR as soon as August 7, valuing Simon & Schuster at ~$1.62B  —  The deal with KKR, a private equity firm, is said to be valued at roughly $1.62 billion, and could be announced as soon as Monday.
